meanings.definition: Waste material scattered around in an untidy manner.
meanings.sent1: The park was covered in litter after the picnic.
meanings.sent2: Please pick up your litter and throw it in the bin.
meanings.sent3: The litter left behind by the party reminded me of the importance of keeping our environment clean.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a litter of thoughts, each one vying for attention.
meanings.sent5: The litter on the beach painted a sad picture of human disregard for nature.

meanings.definition: A group of young animals born to an animal at one time.
meanings.sent1: The cat had a litter of five adorable kittens.
meanings.sent2: The litter of puppies played joyfully in the yard.
meanings.sent3: The litter of ducklings followed their mother in a cute line.
meanings.sent4: The litter of piglets snuggled together for warmth.
meanings.sent5: The litter of bunnies hopped around the garden, exploring everything in sight.

meanings.definition: To scatter (objects) untidily around a place.
meanings.sent1: Please do not litter the streets with trash.
meanings.sent2: He tends to litter his room with clothes and books.
meanings.sent3: She decided to litter the path with flower petals for a romantic surprise.
meanings.sent4: The wind began to litter the fallen leaves across the yard.
meanings.sent5: The artist would litter paint across the canvas, creating a masterpiece of colors.
